Detailed Description

Small, compact and optimized IRC Library in C.

Author:
F. J. Yáñez Fernández.
Date:
2004
Version:
0.4.1

Enumeration Type Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Server status.

  • DISCONNECTED You are disconnected from the server.
  • CONNECTING You are connecting to the server.
  • CONNECTED You connected (and registered) to the server.

Precondition:
Use irc_ini_server(&your_server) first!

Function Documentation

int irc_connect (  struct irc_server *  server  ) 
 

Makes a connection to an irc server.

Parameters:
server Struct which stores the necessary information of the target server.
Return values:
1 when connected.
-2 if the server host couldn't be resolved.
-1 if the connection atempt failed.

int irc_pong (  struct irc_server *  server  ) 
 

Check if the server did a ping, and reply if it is necessary.

Parameters:
server Struct which stores the necessary information of the target server.
Return values:
1 The server did a ping and it was replied.
0 No ping from server detected. command.

Returns:
The number of characters read.
Return values:
-1 An I/O error ocurred.
-2 The connection is closed.

int irc_receive (  struct irc_server *  server,
int  timeout
) 
 

Receives data from an irc server.

Parameters:
server Struct which stores the necessary information of the target server.
timeout Time to block and wait for data. When it's 0, the function returns inmediatly, but if it's -1 the function blocks until new data is received.
Returns:
The number of characters read.
Return values:
-1 An I/O error ocurred.
-2 The connection is closed.

parameters Command's parameters.
Returns:

Return values:
-1 An error ocurred.
